content: If you were a hiring manager for a customer service call center, and you're interviewing a candidate that has never worked in a customer service call center environment before, what would you look for in previous job experience that you feel would have used skills that transfer well to your customer service environment?

chosen: I would look for previous job experiences where the candidate has had to interact with customers or clients in some capacity. This could include roles such as retail sales, food service, hospitality, or any other position where the candidate has had to provide customer service, even if it was not in a formal call center environment. I would also consider jobs that involved problem-solving, communication, and empathy, as these are all important skills for customer service representatives.
rejected: I would look for jobs that involved a lot of interaction with people. Jobs such as retail salesperson or restaurant server require employees to interact with customers on a regular basis. These types of jobs can provide good preparation for working in a call center environment because they help develop the interpersonal skills necessary to be successful at customer service.
